request_pathways.name: Authorization to Release Protected Health Information (English)
Autorización para Liberar Información de Salud Protegida (Spanish)

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients are directed to MyChart as the primary access route; the downloadable PDF is a generic HIPAA authorization form with a 'Personal Use' checkbox but no dedicated patient-access pathway.

red_flags: Copy of ID required as blanket requirement with no alternative verification methods — potentially burdensome for FQHC population lacking government-issued ID
Fee schedule referenced ('Please refer to Pay Scale for rates') but not provided or linked — patients cannot learn costs before submitting
bright_spots: Bilingual forms (English and Spanish) linked side-by-side from dedicated records request page
Encrypted email offered as a delivery method — a modern patient-friendly option
Granular record-type selection with 9 specific categories plus 'Other'
Dedicated /recordsrequest/ page that also promotes MyChart patient portal as primary access route

findability.rationale: Level 5: Prominently available with minimal effort — forms are directly linked from a dedicated /recordsrequest/ page and immediately surface via basic web search with no barriers.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Mostly digital workflow — fillable PDF with 54 interactive fields can be completed digitally, then submitted via fax or encrypted email; the one gap is no direct online form submission.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized single-page form with clear section headers and logical flow, but minor issues include the cryptic 'Pay Scale' reference, dense legal disclaimers directed at receiving parties, and outdated CD-ROM format option.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the form via the 'Personal Use' checkbox, but the generic bidirectional authorization design was not built for patient self-access — patients must figure out which direction checkbox and recipient fields apply to them.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: Some requirements exceed what HIPAA mandates for patient access — blanket copy-of-ID requirement with no alternatives, undisclosed fee schedule, and ambiguous witness signature line that may impose unnecessary procedural steps.

overall.summary: Erie Family Health Centers earns a B with strong findability and a functional fillable bilingual form, but is held back by the lack of a dedicated patient-access pathway, undisclosed fees, and a blanket ID requirement.
